And*p Moses said unto the people, Fear not: for God is come to prove you, and that his fear may be before your faces, that ye sin not.
And*p the people stood afar off, and Moses drew near unto the thick darkness where God was.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Thus thou shalt say unto the children of Israel, Ye have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
Ye*p shall not make with me gods of silver, neither shall ye make unto you gods of gold.

An*p altar of earth thou shalt make unto me, and shalt sacrifice thereon thy burnt offerings, and thy peace offerings, thy sheep, and thine oxen: in all places where I record my name I will come unto thee, and I will bless thee.
And*p if thou wilt make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build it of hewn stone: for if thou lift up thy tool upon it, thou hast polluted it.
Neither*p shalt thou go up by steps unto mine altar, that thy nakedness be not discovered thereon.
Exodus 21
Now*p these are the judgments which thou shalt set before them.
If*p thou buy an Hebrew servant, six years he shall serve: and in the seventh he shall go out free for nothing.
If*p he came in by himself, he shall go out by himself: if he were married, then his wife shall go out with him.
If*p his master have given him a wife, and she have born him sons or daughters; the wife and her children shall be her master's, and he shall go out by himself.
And*p if the servant shall plainly say, I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free:
Then*p his master shall bring him unto the judges; he shall also bring him to the door, or unto the door post; and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl; and he shall serve him for ever.
And*p if a man sell his daughter to be a maidservant, she shall not go out as the menservants do.

If*p she please not her master, who hath betrothed her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell her unto a strange nation he shall have no power, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully with her.
And*p if he have betrothed her unto his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.
If*p he take him another wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage, shall he not diminish.
And*p if he do not these three unto her, then shall she go out free without money.
He*p that smiteth a man, so that he die, shall be surely put to death.
And*p if a man lie not in wait, but God deliver him into his hand; then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.
But*p if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbour, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.
And*p he that smiteth his father, or his mother, shall be surely put to death.
And*p he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, or if he be found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.
And*p he that curseth his father, or his mother, shall surely be put to death.
And*p if men strive together, and one smite another with a stone, or with his fist, and he die not, but keepeth his bed:
If*p he rise again, and walk abroad upon his staff, then shall he that smote him be quit: only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.
And*p if a man smite his servant, or his maid, with a rod, and he die under his hand; he shall be surely punished.
Notwithstanding,*p if he continue a day or two, he shall not be punished: for he is his money.

If*p men strive, and hurt a woman with child, so that her fruit depart from her, and yet no mischief follow: he shall be surely punished, according as the woman's husband will lay upon him; and he shall pay as the judges determine.
And*p if any mischief follow, then thou shalt give life for life,
Eye*p for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
Burning*p for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
And*p if a man smite the eye of his servant, or the eye of his maid, that it perish; he shall let him go free for his eye's sake.
And*p if he smite out his manservant's tooth, or his maidservant's tooth; he shall let him go free for his tooth's sake.
If*p an ox gore a man or a woman, that they die: then the ox shall be surely stoned, and his flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be quit.

But*p if the ox were wont to push with his horn in time past, and it hath been testified to his owner, and he hath not kept him in, but that he hath killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.
If*p there be laid on him a sum of money, then he shall give for the ransom of his life whatsoever is laid upon him.
Whether*p he have gored a son, or have gored a daughter, according to this judgment shall it be done unto him.
If*p the ox shall push a manservant or a maidservant; he shall give unto their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
And*p if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit, and not cover it, and an ox or an ass fall therein;
The*p owner of the pit shall make it good, and give money unto the owner of them; and the dead beast shall be his.
And*p if one man's ox hurt another's, that he die; then they shall sell the live ox, and divide the money of it; and the dead ox also they shall divide.
Or*p if it be known that the ox hath used to push in time past, and his owner hath not kept him in; he shall surely pay ox for ox; and the dead shall be his own.
Exodus 22
If*p a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
If*p a thief be found breaking up, and be smitten that he die, there shall no blood be shed for him.
If*p the sun be risen upon him, there shall be blood shed for him; for he should make full restitution; if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
If*p the theft be certainly found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restore double.

If*p a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall put in his beast, and shall feed in another man's field; of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he make restitution.
If*p fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed therewith; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
If*p a man shall deliver unto his neighbour money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man's house; if the thief be found, let him pay double.
If*p the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the judges, to see whether he have put his hand unto his neighbour's goods.

For*p all manner of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, which another challengeth to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whom the judges shall condemn, he shall pay double unto his neighbour.
If*p a man deliver unto his neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it:
Then*p shall an oath of the Lord*s be between them both, that he hath not put his hand unto his neighbour's goods; and the owner of it shall accept thereof, and he shall not make it good.
And*p if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.
If*p it be torn in pieces, then let him bring it for witness, and he shall not make good that which was torn.
And*p if a man borrow ought of his neighbour, and it be hurt, or die, the owner thereof being not with it, he shall surely make it good.
But*p if the owner thereof be with it, he shall not make it good: if it be an hired thing, it came for his hire.
And*p if a man entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife.
If*p her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
Thou*p shalt not suffer a witch to live.
Whosoever*p lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.
He*p that sacrificeth unto any god, save unto the Lord*s only, he shall be utterly destroyed.
Thou*p shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Ye*p shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
If*p thou afflict them in any wise, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;
And*p my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
If*p thou lend money to any of my people that is poor by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon him usury.
If*p thou at all take thy neighbour's raiment to pledge, thou shalt deliver it unto him by that the sun goeth down:
For*p that is his covering only, it is his raiment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth unto me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.
Thou*p shalt not revile the gods, nor curse the ruler of thy people.
Thou*p shalt not delay to offer the first of thy ripe fruits, and of thy liquors: the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give unto me.
Likewise*p shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with his dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it me.
And*p ye shall be holy men unto me: neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.
Exodus 23
Thou*p shalt not raise a false report: put not thine hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
Thou*p shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:
Neither*p shalt thou countenance a poor man in his cause.
If*p thou meet thine enemy's ox or his ass going astray, thou shalt surely bring it back to him again.
If*p thou see the ass of him that hateth thee lying under his burden, and wouldest forbear to help him, thou shalt surely help with him.
Thou*p shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.
Keep*p thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.
And*p thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
Also*p thou shalt not oppress a stranger: for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
And*p six years thou shalt sow thy land, and shalt gather in the fruits thereof:

But*p the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and lie still; that the poor of thy people may eat: and what they leave the beasts of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with thy vineyard, and with thy oliveyard.
Six*p days thou shalt do thy work, and on the seventh day thou shalt rest: that thine ox and thine ass may rest, and the son of thy handmaid, and the stranger, may be refreshed.
And*p in all things that I have said unto you be circumspect: and make no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out of thy mouth.
Three*p times thou shalt keep a feast unto me in the year.

Thou*p shalt keep the feast of unleavened bread: (thou shalt eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded thee, in the time appointed of the month Abib; for in it thou camest out from Egypt: and none shall appear before me empty:)

And*p the feast of harvest, the firstfruits of thy labours, which thou hast sown in the field: and the feast of ingathering, which is in the end of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labours out of the field.
Three*p times in the year all thy males shall appear before the Lord God.*s
Thou*p shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my sacrifice remain until the morning.
The*p first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring into the house of the Lord*s thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.
Behold,*p I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
Beware*p of him, and obey his voice, provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgressions: for my name is in him.
But*p if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.
For*p mine Angel shall go before thee, and bring thee in unto the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites: and I will cut them off.
Thou*p shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works: but thou shalt utterly overthrow them, and quite break down their images.
And*p ye shall serve the Lord*s your God, and he shall bless thy bread, and thy water; and I will take sickness away from the midst of thee.
There*p shall nothing cast their young, nor be barren, in thy land: the number of thy days I will fulfil.
I*p will send my fear before thee, and will destroy all the people to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thine enemies turn their backs unto thee.
And*p I will send hornets before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before thee.
I*p will not drive them out from before thee in one year; lest the land become desolate, and the beast of the field multiply against thee.
By*p little and little I will drive them out from before thee, until thou be increased, and inherit the land.

And*p I will set thy bounds from the Red sea even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert unto the river: for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand; and thou shalt drive them out before thee.
Thou*p shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
They*p shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me: for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.
Exodus 24
And*p he said unto Moses, Come up unto the Lord,*s thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off.
And*p Moses alone shall come near the Lord:*s but they shall not come nigh; neither shall the people go up with him.
And*p Moses came and told the people all the words of the Lord,*s and all the judgments: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which the Lord*s hath said will we do.
And*p Moses wrote all the words of the Lord,*s and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the hill, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
And*p he sent young men of the children of Israel, which offered burnt offerings, and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen unto the Lord.*s
And*p Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basins; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
And*p he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that the Lord*s hath said will we do, and be obedient.
And*p Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which the Lord*s hath made with you concerning all these words.
Then*p went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel:
And*p they saw the God of Israel: and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of a sapphire stone, and as it were the body of heaven in his clearness.
And*p upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: also they saw God, and did eat and drink.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee tables of stone, and a law, and commandments which I have written; that thou mayest teach them.
And*p Moses rose up, and his minister Joshua: and Moses went up into the mount of God.
And*p he said unto the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again unto you: and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: if any man have any matters to do, let him come unto them.
And*p Moses went up into the mount, and a cloud covered the mount.
And*p the glory of the Lord*s abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
And*p the sight of the glory of the Lord*s was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the children of Israel.
And*p Moses went into the midst of the cloud, and gat him up into the mount: and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
Exodus 25
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak*p unto the children of Israel, that they bring me an offering: of every man that giveth it willingly with his heart ye shall take my offering.
And*p this is the offering which ye shall take of them; gold, and silver, and brass,
And*p blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair,
And*p rams' skins dyed red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood,
Oil*p for the light, spices for anointing oil, and for sweet incense,
Onyx*p stones, and stones to be set in the ephod, and in the breastplate.
And*p let them make me a sanctuary; that I may dwell among them.
According*p to all that I shew thee, after the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all the instruments thereof, even so shall ye make it.
And*p they shall make an ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
And*p thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without shalt thou overlay it, and shalt make upon it a crown of gold round about.
And*p thou shalt cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in the four corners thereof; and two rings shall be in the one side of it, and two rings in the other side of it.
And*p thou shalt make staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.
And*p thou shalt put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, that the ark may be borne with them.
The*p staves shall be in the rings of the ark: they shall not be taken from it.
And*p thou shalt put into the ark the testimony which I shall give thee.
And*p thou shalt make a mercy seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
And*p thou shalt make two cherubims of gold, of beaten work shalt thou make them, in the two ends of the mercy seat.
And*p make one cherub on the one end, and the other cherub on the other end: even of the mercy seat shall ye make the cherubims on the two ends thereof.

And*p the cherubims shall stretch forth their wings on high, covering the mercy seat with their wings, and their faces shall look one to another; toward the mercy seat shall the faces of the cherubims be.
And*p thou shalt put the mercy seat above upon the ark; and in the ark thou shalt put the testimony that I shall give thee.

And*p there I will meet with thee, and I will commune with thee from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubims which are upon the ark of the testimony, of all things which I will give thee in commandment unto the children of Israel.
Thou*p shalt also make a table of shittim wood: two cubits shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
And*p thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, and make thereto a crown of gold round about.
And*p thou shalt make unto it a border of an hand breadth round about, and thou shalt make a golden crown to the border thereof round about.
And*p thou shalt make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that are on the four feet thereof.
Over*p against the border shall the rings be for places of the staves to bear the table.
And*p thou shalt make the staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be borne with them.
And*p thou shalt make the dishes thereof, and spoons thereof, and covers thereof, and bowls thereof, to cover withal: of pure gold shalt thou make them.
And*p thou shalt set upon the table shewbread before me alway.
And*p thou shalt make a candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work shall the candlestick be made: his shaft, and his branches, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, shall be of the same.
And*p six branches shall come out of the sides of it; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side:

Three*p bowls made like unto almonds, with a knop and a flower in one branch; and three bowls made like almonds in the other branch, with a knop and a flower: so in the six branches that come out of the candlestick.
And*p in the candlestick shall be four bowls made like unto almonds, with their knops and their flowers.

And*p there shall be a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches that proceed out of the candlestick.
Their*p knops and their branches shall be of the same: all it shall be one beaten work of pure gold.
And*p thou shalt make the seven lamps thereof: and they shall light the lamps thereof, that they may give light over against it.
And*p the tongs thereof, and the snuffdishes thereof, shall be of pure gold.
Of*p a talent of pure gold shall he make it, with all these vessels.
And*p look that thou make them after their pattern, which was shewed thee in the mount.
Exodus 26
Moreover*p thou shalt make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work shalt thou make them.
The*p length of one curtain shall be eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and every one of the curtains shall have one measure.
The*p five curtains shall be coupled together one to another; and other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.

And*p thou shalt make loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling; and likewise shalt thou make in the uttermost edge of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
Fifty*p loops shalt thou make in the one curtain, and fifty loops shalt thou make in the edge of the curtain that is in the coupling of the second; that the loops may take hold one of another.
And*p thou shalt make fifty taches of gold, and couple the curtains together with the taches: and it shall be one tabernacle.
And*p thou shalt make curtains of goats' hair to be a covering upon the tabernacle: eleven curtains shalt thou make.
The*p length of one curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and the eleven curtains shall be all of one measure.
And*p thou shalt couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and shalt double the sixth curtain in the forefront of the tabernacle.
And*p thou shalt make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain that is outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops in the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
And*p thou shalt make fifty taches of brass, and put the taches into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.
And*p the remnant that remaineth of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remaineth, shall hang over the backside of the tabernacle.

And*p a cubit on the one side, and a cubit on the other side of that which remaineth in the length of the curtains of the tent, it shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.
And*p thou shalt make a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering above of badgers' skins.
And*p thou shalt make boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood standing up.
Ten*p cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a half shall be the breadth of one board.
Two*p tenons shall there be in one board, set in order one against another: thus shalt thou make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
And*p thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards on the south side southward.
And*p thou shalt make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
And*p for the second side of the tabernacle on the north side there shall be twenty boards:
And*p their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
And*p for the sides of the tabernacle westward thou shalt make six boards.
And*p two boards shalt thou make for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
And*p they shall be coupled together beneath, and they shall be coupled together above the head of it unto one ring: thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.
And*p they shall be eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
And*p thou shalt make bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
And*p five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the two sides westward.
And*p the middle bar in the midst of the boards shall reach from end to end.
And*p thou shalt overlay the boards with gold, and make their rings of gold for places for the bars: and thou shalt overlay the bars with gold.
And*p thou shalt rear up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which was shewed thee in the mount.
And*p thou shalt make a veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen of cunning work: with cherubims shall it be made:
And*p thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of shittim wood overlaid with gold: their hooks shall be of gold, upon the four sockets of silver.

And*p thou shalt hang up the veil under the taches, that thou mayest bring in thither within the veil the ark of the testimony: and the veil shall divide unto you between the holy place and the most holy.
And*p thou shalt put the mercy seat upon the ark of the testimony in the most holy place.
And*p thou shalt set the table without the veil, and the candlestick over against the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south: and thou shalt put the table on the north side.
And*p thou shalt make an hanging for the door of the tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework.
And*p thou shalt make for the hanging five pillars of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold, and their hooks shall be of gold: and thou shalt cast five sockets of brass for them.
Exodus 27
And*p thou shalt make an altar of shittim wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and the height thereof shall be three cubits.
And*p thou shalt make the horns of it upon the four corners thereof: his horns shall be of the same: and thou shalt overlay it with brass.
And*p thou shalt make his pans to receive his ashes, and his shovels, and his basins, and his fleshhooks, and his firepans: all the vessels thereof thou shalt make of brass.
And*p thou shalt make for it a grate of network of brass; and upon the net shalt thou make four brasen rings in the four corners thereof.
And*p thou shalt put it under the compass of the altar beneath, that the net may be even to the midst of the altar.
And*p thou shalt make staves for the altar, staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with brass.
And*p the staves shall be put into the rings, and the staves shall be upon the two sides of the altar, to bear it.
Hollow*p with boards shalt thou make it: as it was shewed thee in the mount, so shall they make it.
And*p thou shalt make the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward there shall be hangings for the court of fine twined linen of an hundred cubits long for one side:
And*p the twenty pillars thereof and their twenty sockets shall be of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.

And*p likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings of an hundred cubits long, and his twenty pillars and their twenty sockets of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
And*p for the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits: their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
And*p the breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be fifty cubits.
The*p hangings of one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits: their pillars three, and their sockets three.
And*p on the other side shall be hangings fifteen cubits: their pillars three, and their sockets three.

And*p for the gate of the court shall be an hanging of twenty cubits, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework: and their pillars shall be four, and their sockets four.
All*p the pillars round about the court shall be filleted with silver; their hooks shall be of silver, and their sockets of brass.
The*p length of the court shall be an hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty every where, and the height five cubits of fine twined linen, and their sockets of brass.
All*p the vessels of the tabernacle in all the service thereof, and all the pins thereof, and all the pins of the court, shall be of brass.
And*p thou shalt command the children of Israel, that they bring thee pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamp to burn always.

In*p the tabernacle of the congregation without the veil, which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall order it from evening to morning before the Lord:*s it shall be a statute for ever unto their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.
Exodus 28

And*p take thou unto thee Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office, even Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron's sons.
And*p thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother for glory and for beauty.

And*p thou shalt speak unto all that are wise hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron's garments to consecrate him, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.

And*p these are the garments which they shall make; a breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a broidered coat, a mitre, and a girdle: and they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, and his sons, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.
And*p they shall take gold, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen.
And*p they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, and of purple, of scarlet, and fine twined linen, with cunning work.
It*p shall have the two shoulderpieces thereof joined at the two edges thereof; and so it shall be joined together.
And*p the curious girdle of the ephod, which is upon it, shall be of the same, according to the work thereof; even of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
And*p thou shalt take two onyx stones, and grave on them the names of the children of Israel:
Six*p of their names on one stone, and the other six names of the rest on the other stone, according to their birth.
With*p the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, shalt thou engrave the two stones with the names of the children of Israel: thou shalt make them to be set in ouches of gold.

And*p thou shalt put the two stones upon the shoulders of the ephod for stones of memorial unto the children of Israel: and Aaron shall bear their names before the Lord*s upon his two shoulders for a memorial.
And*p thou shalt make ouches of gold;
And*p two chains of pure gold at the ends; of wreathen work shalt thou make them, and fasten the wreathen chains to the ouches.

And*p thou shalt make the breastplate of judgment with cunning work; after the work of the ephod thou shalt make it; of gold, of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine twined linen, shalt thou make it.
Foursquare*p it shall be being doubled; a span shall be the length thereof, and a span shall be the breadth thereof.
And*p thou shalt set in it settings of stones, even four rows of stones: the first row shall be a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this shall be the first row.
And*p the second row shall be an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
And*p the third row a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
And*p the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.

And*p the stones shall be with the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet; every one with his name shall they be according to the twelve tribes.
And*p thou shalt make upon the breastplate chains at the ends of wreathen work of pure gold.
And*p thou shalt make upon the breastplate two rings of gold, and shalt put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
And*p thou shalt put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings which are on the ends of the breastplate.
And*p the other two ends of the two wreathen chains thou shalt fasten in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod before it.
And*p thou shalt make two rings of gold, and thou shalt put them upon the two ends of the breastplate in the border thereof, which is in the side of the ephod inward.

And*p two other rings of gold thou shalt make, and shalt put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart thereof, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.

And*p they shall bind the breastplate by the rings thereof unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate be not loosed from the ephod.
And*p Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment upon his heart, when he goeth in unto the holy place, for a memorial before the Lord*s continually.

And*p thou shalt put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be upon Aaron's heart, when he goeth in before the Lord:*s and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel upon his heart before the Lord*s continually.
And*p thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
And*p there shall be an hole in the top of it, in the midst thereof: it shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as it were the hole of an habergeon, that it be not rent.
And*p beneath upon the hem of it thou shalt make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, round about the hem thereof; and bells of gold between them round about:
A*p golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe round about.
And*p it shall be upon Aaron to minister: and his sound shall be heard when he goeth in unto the holy place before the Lord,*s and when he cometh out, that he die not.
And*p thou shalt make a plate of pure gold, and grave upon it, like the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.*s
And*p thou shalt put it on a blue lace, that it may be upon the mitre; upon the forefront of the mitre it shall be.

And*p it shall be upon Aaron's forehead, that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the children of Israel shall hallow in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always upon his forehead, that they may be accepted before the Lord.*s
And*p thou shalt embroider the coat of fine linen, and thou shalt make the mitre of fine linen, and thou shalt make the girdle of needlework.
And*p for Aaron's sons thou shalt make coats, and thou shalt make for them girdles, and bonnets shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.
And*p thou shalt put them upon Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him; and shalt anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister unto me in the priest's office.
And*p thou shalt make them linen breeches to cover their nakedness; from the loins even unto the thighs they shall reach:

And*p they shall be upon Aaron, and upon his sons, when they come in unto the tabernacle of the congregation, or when they come near unto the altar to minister in the holy place; that they bear not iniquity, and die: it shall be a statute for ever unto him and his seed after him.
Exodus 29
And*p this is the thing that thou shalt do unto them to hallow them, to minister unto me in the priest's office: Take one young bullock, and two rams without blemish,
And*p unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: of wheaten flour shalt thou make them.
And*p thou shalt put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.
And*p Aaron and his sons thou shalt bring unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shalt wash them with water.
And*p thou shalt take the garments, and put upon Aaron the coat, and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the curious girdle of the ephod:
And*p thou shalt put the mitre upon his head, and put the holy crown upon the mitre.
Then*p shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour it upon his head, and anoint him.
And*p thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them.

And*p thou shalt gird them with girdles, Aaron and his sons, and put the bonnets on them: and the priest's office shall be theirs for a perpetual statute: and thou shalt consecrate Aaron and his sons.
And*p thou shalt cause a bullock to be brought before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the bullock.
And*p thou shalt kill the bullock before the Lord,*s by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and put it upon the horns of the altar with thy finger, and pour all the blood beside the bottom of the altar.
And*p thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul that is above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and burn them upon the altar.
But*p the flesh of the bullock, and his skin, and his dung, shalt thou burn with fire without the camp: it is a sin offering.
Thou*p shalt also take one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
And*p thou shalt slay the ram, and thou shalt take his blood, and sprinkle it round about upon the altar.
And*p thou shalt cut the ram in pieces, and wash the inwards of him, and his legs, and put them unto his pieces, and unto his head.
And*p thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar: it is a burnt offering unto the Lord:*s it is a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the Lord.*s
And*p thou shalt take the other ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.

Then*p shalt thou kill the ram, and take of his blood, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and upon the tip of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.

And*p thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be hallowed, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons' garments with him.

Also*p thou shalt take of the ram the fat and the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder; for it is a ram of consecration:
And*p one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the Lord:*s
And*p thou shalt put all in the hands of Aaron, and in the hands of his sons; and shalt wave them for a wave offering before the Lord.*s
And*p thou shalt receive them of their hands, and burn them upon the altar for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour before the Lord:*s it is an offering made by fire unto the Lord.*s
And*p thou shalt take the breast of the ram of Aaron's consecration, and wave it for a wave offering before the Lord:*s and it shall be thy part.

And*p thou shalt sanctify the breast of the wave offering, and the shoulder of the heave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of the consecration, even of that which is for Aaron, and of that which is for his sons:

And*p it shall be Aaron's and his sons' by a statute for ever from the children of Israel: for it is an heave offering: and it shall be an heave offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifice of their peace offerings, even their heave offering unto the Lord.*s
And*p the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons' after him, to be anointed therein, and to be consecrated in them.
And*p that son that is priest in his stead shall put them on seven days, when he cometh into the tabernacle of the congregation to minister in the holy place.
And*p thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.
And*p Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p they shall eat those things wherewith the atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat thereof, because they are holy.
And*p if ought of the flesh of the consecrations, or of the bread, remain unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
And*p thus shalt thou do unto Aaron, and to his sons, according to all things which I have commanded thee: seven days shalt thou consecrate them.
And*p thou shalt offer every day a bullock for a sin offering for atonement: and thou shalt cleanse the altar, when thou hast made an atonement for it, and thou shalt anoint it, to sanctify it.
Seven*p days thou shalt make an atonement for the altar, and sanctify it; and it shall be an altar most holy: whatsoever toucheth the altar shall be holy.
Now*p this is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar; two lambs of the first year day by day continually.
The*p one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning; and the other lamb thou shalt offer at even:
And*p with the one lamb a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of beaten oil; and the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offering.

And*p the other lamb thou shalt offer at even, and shalt do thereto according to the meat offering of the morning, and according to the drink offering thereof, for a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the Lord.*s
This*p shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the Lord:*s where I will meet you, to speak there unto thee.
And*p there I will meet with the children of Israel, and the tabernacle shall be sanctified by my glory.
And*p I will sanctify the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar: I will sanctify also both Aaron and his sons, to minister to me in the priest's office.
And*p I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God.
And*p they shall know that I am the Lord*s their God, that brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell among them: I am the Lord*s their God.
Exodus 30
And*p thou shalt make an altar to burn incense upon: of shittim wood shalt thou make it.
A*p cubit shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof; foursquare shall it be: and two cubits shall be the height thereof: the horns thereof shall be of the same.
And*p thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, the top thereof, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns thereof; and thou shalt make unto it a crown of gold round about.

And*p two golden rings shalt thou make to it under the crown of it, by the two corners thereof, upon the two sides of it shalt thou make it; and they shall be for places for the staves to bear it withal.
And*p thou shalt make the staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.
And*p thou shalt put it before the veil that is by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with thee.
And*p Aaron shall burn thereon sweet incense every morning: when he dresseth the lamps, he shall burn incense upon it.
And*p when Aaron lighteth the lamps at even, he shall burn incense upon it, a perpetual incense before the Lord*s throughout your generations.
Ye*p shall offer no strange incense thereon, nor burnt sacrifice, nor meat offering; neither shall ye pour drink offering thereon.

And*p Aaron shall make an atonement upon the horns of it once in a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonements: once in the year shall he make atonement upon it throughout your generations: it is most holy unto the Lord.*s
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

When*p thou takest the sum of the children of Israel after their number, then shall they give every man a ransom for his soul unto the Lord,*s when thou numberest them; that there be no plague among them, when thou numberest them.

This*p they shall give, every one that passeth among them that are numbered, half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary: (a shekel is twenty gerahs:) an half shekel shall be the offering of the Lord.*s
Every*p one that passeth among them that are numbered, from twenty years old and above, shall give an offering unto the Lord.*s
The*p rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when they give an offering unto the Lord,*s to make an atonement for your souls.

And*p thou shalt take the atonement money of the children of Israel, and shalt appoint it for the service of the tabernacle of the congregation; that it may be a memorial unto the children of Israel before the Lord,*s to make an atonement for your souls.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Thou*p shalt also make a laver of brass, and his foot also of brass, to wash withal: and thou shalt put it between the tabernacle of the congregation and the altar, and thou shalt put water therein.
For*p Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet thereat:
When*p they go into the tabernacle of the congregation, they shall wash with water, that they die not; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn offering made by fire unto the Lord:*s
So*p they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they die not: and it shall be a statute for ever to them, even to him and to his seed throughout their generations.
Moreover*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Take*p thou also unto thee principal spices, of pure myrrh five hundred shekels, and of sweet cinnamon half so much, even two hundred and fifty shekels, and of sweet calamus two hundred and fifty shekels,
And*p of cassia five hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, and of oil olive an hin:
And*p thou shalt make it an oil of holy ointment, an ointment compound after the art of the apothecary: it shall be an holy anointing oil.
And*p thou shalt anoint the tabernacle of the congregation therewith, and the ark of the testimony,
And*p the table and all his vessels, and the candlestick and his vessels, and the altar of incense,
And*p the altar of burnt offering with all his vessels, and the laver and his foot.
And*p thou shalt sanctify them, that they may be most holy: whatsoever toucheth them shall be holy.
And*p thou shalt anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that they may minister unto me in the priest's office.
And*p thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, This shall be an holy anointing oil unto me throughout your generations.
Upon*p man's flesh shall it not be poured, neither shall ye make any other like it, after the composition of it: it is holy, and it shall be holy unto you.
Whosoever*p compoundeth any like it, or whosoever putteth any of it upon a stranger, shall even be cut off from his people.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Take unto thee sweet spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum; these sweet spices with pure frankincense: of each shall there be a like weight:
And*p thou shalt make it a perfume, a confection after the art of the apothecary, tempered together, pure and holy:
And*p thou shalt beat some of it very small, and put of it before the testimony in the tabernacle of the congregation, where I will meet with thee: it shall be unto you most holy.
And*p as for the perfume which thou shalt make, ye shall not make to yourselves according to the composition thereof: it shall be unto thee holy for the Lord.*s
Whosoever*p shall make like unto that, to smell thereto, shall even be cut off from his people.
Exodus 31
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
See,*p I have called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah:
And*p I have filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,
To*p devise cunning works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
And*p in cutting of stones, to set them, and in carving of timber, to work in all manner of workmanship.

And*p I, behold, I have given with him Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan: and in the hearts of all that are wise hearted I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have commanded thee;
The*p tabernacle of the congregation, and the ark of the testimony, and the mercy seat that is thereupon, and all the furniture of the tabernacle,
And*p the table and his furniture, and the pure candlestick with all his furniture, and the altar of incense,
And*p the altar of burnt offering with all his furniture, and the laver and his foot,
And*p the cloths of service, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office,
And*p the anointing oil, and sweet incense for the holy place: according to all that I have commanded thee shall they do.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Speak*p thou also unto the children of Israel, saying, Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the Lord*s that doth sanctify you.

Ye*p shall keep the sabbath therefore; for it is holy unto you: every one that defileth it shall surely be put to death: for whosoever doeth any work therein, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
Six*p days may work be done; but in the seventh is the sabbath of rest, holy to the Lord:*s whosoever doeth any work in the sabbath day, he shall surely be put to death.
Wherefore*p the children of Israel shall keep the sabbath, to observe the sabbath throughout their generations, for a perpetual covenant.
It*p is a sign between me and the children of Israel for ever: for in six days the Lord*s made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested, and was refreshed.
And*p he gave unto Moses, when he had made an end of communing with him upon mount Sinai, two tables of testimony, tables of stone, written with the finger of God.
Exodus 32

And*p when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down out of the mount, the people gathered themselves together unto Aaron, and said unto him, Up, make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.
And*p Aaron said unto them, Break off the golden earrings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them unto me.
And*p all the people brake off the golden earrings which were in their ears, and brought them unto Aaron.

And*p he received them at their hand, and fashioned it with a graving tool, after he had made it a molten calf: and they said, These be thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
And*p when Aaron saw it, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made proclamation, and said, To morrow is a feast to the Lord.*s
And*p they rose up early on the morrow, and offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Go, get thee down; for thy people, which thou broughtest out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves:

They*p have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them: they have made them a molten calf, and have worshipped it, and have sacrificed thereunto, and said, These be thy gods, O Israel, which have brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, I have seen this people, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked people:
Now*p therefore let me alone, that my wrath may wax hot against them, and that I may consume them: and I will make of thee a great nation.

And*p Moses besought the Lord*s his God, and said, Lord,*s why doth thy wrath wax hot against thy people, which thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power, and with a mighty hand?

Wherefore*p should the Egyptians speak, and say, For mischief did he bring them out, to slay them in the mountains, and to consume them from the face of the earth? Turn from thy fierce wrath, and repent of this evil against thy people.

Remember*p Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, thy servants, to whom thou swarest by thine own self, and saidst unto them, I will multiply your seed as the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have spoken of will I give unto your seed, and they shall inherit it for ever.
And*p the Lord*s repented of the evil which he thought to do unto his people.

And*p Moses turned, and went down from the mount, and the two tables of the testimony were in his hand: the tables were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other were they written.
And*p the tables were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, graven upon the tables.
And*p when Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said unto Moses, There is a noise of war in the camp.
And*p he said, It is not the voice of them that shout for mastery, neither is it the voice of them that cry for being overcome: but the noise of them that sing do I hear.

And*p it came to pass, as soon as he came nigh unto the camp, that he saw the calf, and the dancing: and Moses' anger waxed hot, and he cast the tables out of his hands, and brake them beneath the mount.
And*p he took the calf which they had made, and burnt it in the fire, and ground it to powder, and strawed it upon the water, and made the children of Israel drink of it.
And*p Moses said unto Aaron, What did this people unto thee, that thou hast brought so great a sin upon them?
And*p Aaron said, Let not the anger of my lord wax hot: thou knowest the people, that they are set on mischief.
For*p they said unto me, Make us gods, which shall go before us: for as for this Moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.
And*p I said unto them, Whosoever hath any gold, let them break it off. So they gave it me: then I cast it into the fire, and there came out this calf.
And*p when Moses saw that the people were naked; (for Aaron had made them naked unto their shame among their enemies:)
Then*p Moses stood in the gate of the camp, and said, Who is on the Lord's*s side? let him come unto me. And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together unto him.

And*p he said unto them, Thus saith the Lord*s God of Israel, Put every man his sword by his side, and go in and out from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay every man his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbour.
And*p the children of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.
For*p Moses had said, Consecrate yourselves to day to the Lord,*s even every man upon his son, and upon his brother; that he may bestow upon you a blessing this day.
And*p it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses said unto the people, Ye have sinned a great sin: and now I will go up unto the Lord;*s peradventure I shall make an atonement for your sin.
And*p Moses returned unto the Lord,*s and said, Oh, this people have sinned a great sin, and have made them gods of gold.
Yet*p now, if thou wilt forgive their sin―; and if not, blot me, I pray thee, out of thy book which thou hast written.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Whosoever hath sinned against me, him will I blot out of my book.
Therefore*p now go, lead the people unto the place of which I have spoken unto thee: behold, mine Angel shall go before thee: nevertheless in the day when I visit I will visit their sin upon them.
And*p the Lord*s plagued the people, because they made the calf, which Aaron made.
Exodus 33

And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Depart, and go up hence, thou and the people which thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt, unto the land which I sware unto Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, Unto thy seed will I give it:
And*p I will send an angel before thee; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:
Unto*p a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou art a stiffnecked people: lest I consume thee in the way.
And*p when the people heard these evil tidings, they mourned: and no man did put on him his ornaments.

For*p the Lord*s had said unto Moses, Say unto the children of Israel, Ye are a stiffnecked people: I will come up into the midst of thee in a moment, and consume thee: therefore now put off thy ornaments from thee, that I may know what to do unto thee.
And*p the children of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments by the mount Horeb.

And*p Moses took the tabernacle, and pitched it without the camp, afar off from the camp, and called it the Tabernacle of the congregation. And it came to pass, that every one which sought the Lord*s went out unto the tabernacle of the congregation, which was without the camp.
And*p it came to pass, when Moses went out unto the tabernacle, that all the people rose up, and stood every man at his tent door, and looked after Moses, until he was gone into the tabernacle.
And*p it came to pass, as Moses entered into the tabernacle, the cloudy pillar descended, and stood at the door of the tabernacle, and the Lord*s talked with Moses.
And*p all the people saw the cloudy pillar stand at the tabernacle door: and all the people rose up and worshipped, every man in his tent door.

And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses face to face, as a man speaketh unto his friend. And he turned again into the camp: but his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, departed not out of the tabernacle.

And*p Moses said unto the Lord,*s See, thou sayest unto me, Bring up this people: and thou hast not let me know whom thou wilt send with me. Yet thou hast said, I know thee by name, and thou hast also found grace in my sight.
Now*p therefore, I pray thee, if I have found grace in thy sight, shew me now thy way, that I may know thee, that I may find grace in thy sight: and consider that this nation is thy people.
And*p he said, My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
And*p he said unto him, If thy presence go not with me, carry us not up hence.

For*p wherein shall it be known here that I and thy people have found grace in thy sight? is it not in that thou goest with us? so shall we be separated, I and thy people, from all the people that are upon the face of the earth.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, I will do this thing also that thou hast spoken: for thou hast found grace in my sight, and I know thee by name.
And*p he said, I beseech thee, shew me thy glory.

And*p he said, I will make all my goodness pass before thee, and I will proclaim the name of the Lord*s before thee; and will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will shew mercy on whom I will shew mercy.
And*p he said, Thou canst not see my face: for there shall no man see me, and live.
And*p the Lord*s said, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand upon a rock:
And*p it shall come to pass, while my glory passeth by, that I will put thee in a clift of the rock, and will cover thee with my hand while I pass by:
And*p I will take away mine hand, and thou shalt see my back parts: but my face shall not be seen.
Exodus 34
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first: and I will write upon these tables the words that were in the first tables, which thou brakest.
And*p be ready in the morning, and come up in the morning unto mount Sinai, and present thyself there to me in the top of the mount.
And*p no man shall come up with thee, neither let any man be seen throughout all the mount; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mount.

And*p he hewed two tables of stone like unto the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up unto mount Sinai, as the Lord*s had commanded him, and took in his hand the two tables of stone.
And*p the Lord*s descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the Lord.*s
And*p the Lord*s passed by before him, and proclaimed, The Lord,*s The Lord*s God, merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in goodness and truth,

Keeping*p mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.
And*p Moses made haste, and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshipped.

And*p he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O Lord, let my Lord, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

And*p he said, Behold, I make a covenant: before all thy people I will do marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation: and all the people among which thou art shall see the work of the Lord:*s for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.
Observe*p thou that which I command thee this day: behold, I drive out before thee the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
Take*p heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee:
But*p ye shall destroy their altars, break their images, and cut down their groves:
For*p thou shalt worship no other god: for the Lord,*s whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God:
Lest*p thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they go a whoring after their gods, and do sacrifice unto their gods, and one call thee, and thou eat of his sacrifice;
And*p thou take of their daughters unto thy sons, and their daughters go a whoring after their gods, and make thy sons go a whoring after their gods.
Thou*p shalt make thee no molten gods.
The*p feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep. Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, in the time of the month Abib: for in the month Abib thou camest out from Egypt.
All*p that openeth the matrix is mine; and every firstling among thy cattle, whether ox or sheep, that is male.

But*p the firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb: and if thou redeem him not, then shalt thou break his neck. All the firstborn of thy sons thou shalt redeem. And none shall appear before me empty.
Six*p days thou shalt work, but on the seventh day thou shalt rest: in earing time and in harvest thou shalt rest.
And*p thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of ingathering at the year's end.
Thrice*p in the year shall all your men children appear before the Lord God,*s the God of Israel.
For*p I will cast out the nations before thee, and enlarge thy borders: neither shall any man desire thy land, when thou shalt go up to appear before the Lord*s thy God thrice in the year.
Thou*p shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leaven; neither shall the sacrifice of the feast of the passover be left unto the morning.
The*p first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring unto the house of the Lord*s thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Write thou these words: for after the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with thee and with Israel.
And*p he was there with the Lord*s forty days and forty nights; he did neither eat bread, nor drink water. And he wrote upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.

And*p it came to pass, when Moses came down from mount Sinai with the two tables of testimony in Moses' hand, when he came down from the mount, that Moses wist not that the skin of his face shone while he talked with him.
And*p when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come nigh him.
And*p Moses called unto them; and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned unto him: and Moses talked with them.
And*p afterward all the children of Israel came nigh: and he gave them in commandment all that the Lord*s had spoken with him in mount Sinai.
And*p till Moses had done speaking with them, he put a veil on his face.
But*p when Moses went in before the Lord*s to speak with him, he took the veil off, until he came out. And he came out, and spake unto the children of Israel that which he was commanded.
And*p the children of Israel saw the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses' face shone: and Moses put the veil upon his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
Exodus 35
And*p Moses gathered all the congregation of the children of Israel together, and said unto them, These are the words which the Lord*s hath commanded, that ye should do them.
Six*p days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be to you an holy day, a sabbath of rest to the Lord:*s whosoever doeth work therein shall be put to death.
Ye*p shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations upon the sabbath day.
And*p Moses spake unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the Lord*s commanded, saying,
Take*p ye from among you an offering unto the Lord:*s whosoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, an offering of the Lord;*s gold, and silver, and brass,
And*p blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair,
And*p rams' skins dyed red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood,
And*p oil for the light, and spices for anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,
And*p onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod, and for the breastplate.
And*p every wise hearted among you shall come, and make all that the Lord*s hath commanded;
The*p tabernacle, his tent, and his covering, his taches, and his boards, his bars, his pillars, and his sockets,
The*p ark, and the staves thereof, with the mercy seat, and the veil of the covering,
The*p table, and his staves, and all his vessels, and the shewbread,
The*p candlestick also for the light, and his furniture, and his lamps, with the oil for the light,
And*p the incense altar, and his staves, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the door at the entering in of the tabernacle,
The*p altar of burnt offering, with his brasen grate, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,
The*p hangings of the court, his pillars, and their sockets, and the hanging for the door of the court,
The*p pins of the tabernacle, and the pins of the court, and their cords,
The*p cloths of service, to do service in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.
And*p all the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.

And*p they came, every one whose heart stirred him up, and every one whom his spirit made willing, and they brought the Lord's*s offering to the work of the tabernacle of the congregation, and for all his service, and for the holy garments.

And*p they came, both men and women, as many as were willing hearted, and brought bracelets, and earrings, and rings, and tablets, all jewels of gold: and every man that offered offered an offering of gold unto the Lord.*s
And*p every man, with whom was found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair, and red skins of rams, and badgers' skins, brought them.
Every*p one that did offer an offering of silver and brass brought the Lord's*s offering: and every man, with whom was found shittim wood for any work of the service, brought it.
And*p all the women that were wise hearted did spin with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, both of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine linen.
And*p all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun goats' hair.
And*p the rulers brought onyx stones, and stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate;
And*p spice, and oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.

The*p children of Israel brought a willing offering unto the Lord,*s every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all manner of work, which the Lord*s had commanded to be made by the hand of Moses.
And*p Moses said unto the children of Israel, See, the Lord*s hath called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
And*p he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;
And*p to devise curious works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
And*p in the cutting of stones, to set them, and in carving of wood, to make any manner of cunning work.
And*p he hath put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.

Them*p hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of work, of the engraver, and of the cunning workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do any work, and of those that devise cunning work.
Exodus 36

Then*p wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whom the Lord*s put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the Lord*s had commanded.
And*p Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whose heart the Lord*s had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:

And*p they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it withal. And they brought yet unto him free offerings every morning.
And*p all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they made;
And*p they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the Lord*s commanded to make.

And*p Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
For*p the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
And*p every wise hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work made he them.
The*p length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtains were all of one size.
And*p he coupled the five curtains one unto another: and the other five curtains he coupled one unto another.
And*p he made loops of blue on the edge of one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the uttermost side of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
Fifty*p loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain which was in the coupling of the second: the loops held one curtain to another.
And*p he made fifty taches of gold, and coupled the curtains one unto another with the taches: so it became one tabernacle.
And*p he made curtains of goats' hair for the tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.
The*p length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtains were of one size.
And*p he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
And*p he made fifty loops upon the uttermost edge of the curtain in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
And*p he made fifty taches of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
And*p he made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers' skins above that.
And*p he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up.
The*p length of a board was ten cubits, and the breadth of a board one cubit and a half.
One*p board had two tenons, equally distant one from another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
And*p he made boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward:
And*p forty sockets of silver he made under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
And*p for the other side of the tabernacle, which is toward the north corner, he made twenty boards,
And*p their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
And*p for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
And*p two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
And*p they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.
And*p there were eight boards; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.
And*p he made bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
And*p five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the sides westward.
And*p he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards from the one end to the other.
And*p he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold to be places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
And*p he made a veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubims made he it of cunning work.
And*p he made thereunto four pillars of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
And*p he made an hanging for the tabernacle door of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, of needlework;
And*p the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their chapiters and their fillets with gold: but their five sockets were of brass.
Exodus 37
And*p Bezaleel made the ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it:
And*p he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.
And*p he cast for it four rings of gold, to be set by the four corners of it; even two rings upon the one side of it, and two rings upon the other side of it.
And*p he made staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
And*p he put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
And*p he made the mercy seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half was the length thereof, and one cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
And*p he made two cherubims of gold, beaten out of one piece made he them, on the two ends of the mercy seat;
One*p cherub on the end on this side, and another cherub on the other end on that side: out of the mercy seat made he the cherubims on the two ends thereof.
And*p the cherubims spread out their wings on high, and covered with their wings over the mercy seat, with their faces one to another; even to the mercy seatward were the faces of the cherubims.
And*p he made the table of shittim wood: two cubits was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof:
And*p he overlaid it with pure gold, and made thereunto a crown of gold round about.
Also*p he made thereunto a border of an handbreadth round about; and made a crown of gold for the border thereof round about.
And*p he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings upon the four corners that were in the four feet thereof.
Over*p against the border were the rings, the places for the staves to bear the table.
And*p he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.
And*p he made the vessels which were upon the table, his dishes, and his spoons, and his bowls, and his covers to cover withal, of pure gold.
And*p he made the candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work made he the candlestick; his shaft, and his branch, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, were of the same:
And*p six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:

Three*p bowls made after the fashion of almonds in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three bowls made like almonds in another branch, a knop and a flower: so throughout the six branches going out of the candlestick.
And*p in the candlestick were four bowls made like almonds, his knops, and his flowers:
And*p a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches going out of it.
Their*p knops and their branches were of the same: all of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
And*p he made his seven lamps, and his snuffers, and his snuffdishes, of pure gold.
Of*p a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels thereof.

And*p he made the incense altar of shittim wood: the length of it was a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit; it was foursquare; and two cubits was the height of it; the horns thereof were of the same.
And*p he overlaid it with pure gold, both the top of it, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it: also he made unto it a crown of gold round about.
And*p he made two rings of gold for it under the crown thereof, by the two corners of it, upon the two sides thereof, to be places for the staves to bear it withal.
And*p he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
And*p he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, according to the work of the apothecary.
Exodus 38
And*p he made the altar of burnt offering of shittim wood: five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof; it was foursquare; and three cubits the height thereof.
And*p he made the horns thereof on the four corners of it; the horns thereof were of the same: and he overlaid it with brass.
And*p he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basins, and the fleshhooks, and the firepans: all the vessels thereof made he of brass.
And*p he made for the altar a brasen grate of network under the compass thereof beneath unto the midst of it.
And*p he cast four rings for the four ends of the grate of brass, to be places for the staves.
And*p he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with brass.
And*p he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, to bear it withal; he made the altar hollow with boards.
And*p he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass, of the lookingglasses of the women assembling, which assembled at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:
Their*p pillars were twenty, and their brasen sockets twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
