And*p for the north side the hangings were an hundred cubits, their pillars were twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
And*p for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
And*p for the east side eastward fifty cubits.
The*p hangings of the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
And*p for the other side of the court gate, on this hand and that hand, were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
All*p the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.

And*p the sockets for the pillars were of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver; and the overlaying of their chapiters of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.

And*p the hanging for the gate of the court was needlework, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: and twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.
And*p their pillars were four, and their sockets of brass four; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their chapiters and their fillets of silver.
And*p all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, were of brass.

This*p is the sum of the tabernacle, even of the tabernacle of testimony, as it was counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son to Aaron the priest.
And*p Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p with him was Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a cunning workman, and an embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and fine linen.

All*p the gold that was occupied for the work in all the work of the holy place, even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
And*p the silver of them that were numbered of the congregation was an hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and threescore and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:

A*p bekah for every man, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.
And*p of the hundred talents of silver were cast the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the veil; an hundred sockets of the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
And*p of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their chapiters, and filleted them.
And*p the brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels.
And*p therewith he made the sockets to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the brasen altar, and the brasen grate for it, and all the vessels of the altar,
And*p the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the court gate, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.
Exodus 39
And*p of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made cloths of service, to do service in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
And*p they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, with cunning work.
They*p made shoulderpieces for it, to couple it together: by the two edges was it coupled together.
And*p the curious girdle of his ephod, that was upon it, was of the same, according to the work thereof; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p they wrought onyx stones inclosed in ouches of gold, graven, as signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.
And*p he put them on the shoulders of the ephod, that they should be stones for a memorial to the children of Israel; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he made the breastplate of cunning work, like the work of the ephod; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
It*p was foursquare; they made the breastplate double: a span was the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, being doubled.
And*p they set in it four rows of stones: the first row was a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this was the first row.
And*p the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
And*p the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
And*p the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: they were inclosed in ouches of gold in their inclosings.
And*p the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, every one with his name, according to the twelve tribes.
And*p they made upon the breastplate chains at the ends, of wreathen work of pure gold.
And*p they made two ouches of gold, and two gold rings; and put the two rings in the two ends of the breastplate.
And*p they put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings on the ends of the breastplate.
And*p the two ends of the two wreathen chains they fastened in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod, before it.
And*p they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, upon the border of it, which was on the side of the ephod inward.

And*p they made two other golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart of it, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.

And*p they did bind the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
And*p there was an hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of an habergeon, with a band round about the hole, that it should not rend.
And*p they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen.
And*p they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, round about between the pomegranates;
A*p bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, round about the hem of the robe to minister in; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p they made coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,
And*p a mitre of fine linen, and goodly bonnets of fine linen, and linen breeches of fine twined linen,
And*p a girdle of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, of needlework; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, like to the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE Lord.*s
And*p they tied unto it a lace of blue, to fasten it on high upon the mitre; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
Thus*p was all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the Lord*s commanded Moses, so did they.
And*p they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the tent, and all his furniture, his taches, his boards, his bars, and his pillars, and his sockets,
And*p the covering of rams' skins dyed red, and the covering of badgers' skins, and the veil of the covering,
The*p ark of the testimony, and the staves thereof, and the mercy seat,
The*p table, and all the vessels thereof, and the shewbread,
The*p pure candlestick, with the lamps thereof, even with the lamps to be set in order, and all the vessels thereof, and the oil for light,
And*p the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the tabernacle door,
The*p brasen altar, and his grate of brass, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,

The*p hangings of the court, his pillars, and his sockets, and the hanging for the court gate, his cords, and his pins, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of the congregation,
The*p cloths of service to do service in the holy place, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons' garments, to minister in the priest's office.
According*p to all that the Lord*s commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.
And*p Moses did look upon all the work, and, behold, they had done it as the Lord*s had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
Exodus 40
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
On*p the first day of the first month shalt thou set up the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
And*p thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony, and cover the ark with the veil.
And*p thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light the lamps thereof.
And*p thou shalt set the altar of gold for the incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the hanging of the door to the tabernacle.
And*p thou shalt set the altar of the burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
And*p thou shalt set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and shalt put water therein.
And*p thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the hanging at the court gate.
And*p thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the vessels thereof: and it shall be holy.
And*p thou shalt anoint the altar of the burnt offering, and all his vessels, and sanctify the altar: and it shall be an altar most holy.
And*p thou shalt anoint the laver and his foot, and sanctify it.
And*p thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and wash them with water.
And*p thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments, and anoint him, and sanctify him; that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.
And*p thou shalt bring his sons, and clothe them with coats:

And*p thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto me in the priest's office: for their anointing shall surely be an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.
Thus*p did Moses: according to all that the Lord*s commanded him, so did he.
And*p it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was reared up.
And*p Moses reared up the tabernacle, and fastened his sockets, and set up the boards thereof, and put in the bars thereof, and reared up his pillars.
And*p he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the staves on the ark, and put the mercy seat above upon the ark:
And*p he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the veil of the covering, and covered the ark of the testimony; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he put the table in the tent of the congregation, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, without the veil.
And*p he set the bread in order upon it before the Lord;*s as the Lord*s had commanded Moses.
And*p he put the candlestick in the tent of the congregation, over against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.
And*p he lighted the lamps before the Lord;*s as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he put the golden altar in the tent of the congregation before the veil:
And*p he burnt sweet incense thereon; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he set up the hanging at the door of the tabernacle.
And*p he put the altar of burnt offering by the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation, and offered upon it the burnt offering and the meat offering; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and put water there, to wash withal.
And*p Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet thereat:
When*p they went into the tent of the congregation, and when they came near unto the altar, they washed; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he reared up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the hanging of the court gate. So Moses finished the work.
Then*p a cloud covered the tent of the congregation, and the glory of the Lord*s filled the tabernacle.
And*p Moses was not able to enter into the tent of the congregation, because the cloud abode thereon, and the glory of the Lord*s filled the tabernacle.
And*p when the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward in all their journeys:
But*p if the cloud were not taken up, then they journeyed not till the day that it was taken up.
For*p the cloud of the Lord*s was upon the tabernacle by day, and fire was on it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
